author: Staff Reporter
text:
To come up at five places in the city at a cost of Rs. 1.25 crore

The City Municipal Corporation has proposed to establish five night shelters for urban homeless at a total cost of Rs. 1.25 crore under the National Urban Livelihoods Mission 2014-15.

Basic amenities

The scheme implemented by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation aims to provide permanent shelters with facilities such as water, sanitation, safety and security to urban homeless.

Areas identified

Officials have identified five areas in the city –Margabandu Road in Ward 16 in Hasthampatti Zone, near water tank in Ward 44 in Guhai Erumapalayam in Ammapet Zone, Corporation Primary School premises in Annathanapatti in Ward 48 in Kondalampatti Zone, Sandaipet in Ward 28 in Suramangalam Zone for men and another one for women in the same area. Each centre will be constructed at a cost of Rs. 25 lakh, they added.

The construction works will begin soon.
title: Salem Corporation to establish night shelters
